item.title: Corona Geek #38 – App Marketing Using YouTube’s New One Channel Design
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: This week we hung out with Dr. Brian Burton, Christopher Spence, Ed Maurina, Matthew Chapman, Richard Harris, Theo Rushin Jr. to discuss app marketing using YouTube's new One Channel design. We also talked about last weekend's Glitch Games GIGJam and Corona SDK plug-in beta testing.
item.content:encoded:
This week we hung out with Dr. Brian Burton, Christopher Spence, Ed Maurina, Matthew Chapman, Richard Harris, Theo Rushin Jr. to discuss app marketing using YouTube’s new One Channel design. We also talked about last weekend’s Glitch Games GIGJam and Corona SDK plug-in beta testing.

Don’t forget to download Roaming Gamer’s 7 Games in 7 Days project code. Ed includes lots of helpful comments and his code is very easy to follow and well organized.

Corona Labs T-Shirt Winner

Congratulations to Chris Maher for winning this week’s Corona Labs’ t-shirt. For your chance to win, follow Corona Geek on Twitter and Facebook, and complete the Corona Geek giveaway form.

 

Thank you for watching, we’ll see you on next week’s Corona Geek hangout!

Remember To Subscribe

  • Download the Corona Geek podcast on iTunes
  • Listen to Corona Geek on Stitcher
  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube

item.title: Hangout Highlights: Glitch Games’ GIGJam 48 Hour Online Corona SDK Hackathon
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: During the full Corona Geek #37 hangout, we talked at length with Graham Ranson about the upcoming GIGJam 48 hour online game development jam that Glitch Games is hosting on May 4th & 5th for Corona SDK developers. Graham tells us all about what it takes to enter, how to submit your app, and how entries will be judged.
item.content:encoded:
During the full Corona Geek #37 hangout, we talked at length with Graham Ranson about the upcoming GIGJam 48 hour online game development jam that Glitch Games is hosting on May 4th & 5th for Corona SDK developers. Graham tells us all about what it takes to enter, how to submit your app, and how entries will be judged.

If you haven’t heard of this event, be sure to check out all the details on the official Glitch Games GIG Jam 48 page. Over $3,300 dollars in prizes will be given away to winners of the jam.

Remember to Subscribe:

  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube
  • Subscribe to the Corona Geek podcast on iTunes
  • Listen on Stitcher

item.title: Hangout Highlights: Plug-In Beta Testing, Facebook Integration, and GIG Jam 48
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: Here are a few highlights from Monday's Corona Geek #36 when we talked about Facebook integration, plug-in beta testing, a gems development jam for Corona SDK developers, and more.
item.content:encoded:
Monday’s Corona Geek Hangout included a lively discussion about Facebook Open Graph Mobile and how Corona SDK supports Facebook’s initiative to get  developers to focus on mobile-first and structured data. Learn how Corona SDK integrates with Facebook.

Later in the hangout we talked about how beta testing has started on Corona SDK plug-ins. A few members of the discussion panel had some interesting ideas for future Corona plug-ins. Learn more about Corona SDK plug-in support.

We also talked about the upcoming GIG Jam 48 online game development jam that Glitch Games is hosting on May 4th & 5th for Corona SDK developers. If you haven’t heard of this event, be sure to check out all the details on the official Glitch Games GIG Jam 48 page.

Check out the full version of Corona Geek #36 for more interesting discussions and some crazy social app ideas.

Remember to Subscribe:

  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube
  • Subscribe to the Corona Geek podcast on iTunes
  • Listen on Stitcher
